intro: Hieracium astroadenium, commonly known as the Australian dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas. Hieracium astroadenium is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
